meanings.definition: The act of issuing too much of something.
meanings.sent1: The overissuance of tickets led to chaos at the event.
meanings.sent2: The company faced financial troubles due to the overissuance of shares.
meanings.sent3: The overissuance of candy at the party made the children very happy.
meanings.sent4: Her overissuance of compliments made everyone feel special.
meanings.sent5: The overissuance of warnings made the employees more cautious.

meanings.definition: The state of having issued an excessive amount.
meanings.sent1: The overissuance of permits caused delays in the construction project.
meanings.sent2: The overissuance of diplomas raised concerns about the school's standards.
meanings.sent3: The overissuance of hugs from the puppy was adorable.
meanings.sent4: His overissuance of apologies showed his sincerity.
meanings.sent5: The overissuance of sunlight made the garden flourish.
